meanings.definition: The basic monetary unit of Thailand.
meanings.sent1: In Thailand, you can buy many things with just one baht.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for baht at the currency exchange.
meanings.sent3: Why did the coin go to school? To get a little baht-ucation!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than a baht, shining brightly in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the baht dropping into the donation box echoed through the temple.

meanings.definition: A unit of weight used in Thailand, equal to about 15 grams.
meanings.sent1: The market vendor measured the spices in bahts for accuracy.
meanings.sent2: She carried a baht of gold around her neck as a symbol of prosperity.
meanings.sent3: The recipe called for a baht of flour, but she accidentally added a pound!
meanings.sent4: His words carried the weight of a baht, influencing the decision of the council.
meanings.sent5: The baht of rice was just enough to feed the family for a week.

meanings.definition: A type of currency used in Thailand.
meanings.sent1: Tourists often need to exchange their currency for baht when visiting Thailand.
meanings.sent2: The street vendor accepted baht as payment for the delicious mango sticky rice.
meanings.sent3: Why did the wallet break up with the coin purse? It couldn't handle the baht pressure!
meanings.sent4: His kindness was a currency more valuable than any baht in his pocket.
meanings.sent5: The colorful baht notes fluttered in the wind, a symbol of economic stability.
